author: ROBERT HOUK rhouk@sixriversmedia.com
title: Washington County acts to reauthorize school security funds | Education | johnsoncitypress.com
text:
Washington County commissioners are moving to reinstate $3.5 million in education capital funds for security upgrades at county schools.
Featured
|
News Article
News Article
Washington County acts to reauthorize school security funds
- By ROBERT HOUK rhouk@sixriversmedia.com
The Washington County School System is making security upgrades to the entrances of Daniel Boone and David Crockett high schools.
- By ROBERT HOUK rhouk@sixriversmedia.com
- By ROBERT HOUK rhouk@sixriversmedia.com

author: Andrea Carboni e Elisabetta Tola
title: Bologna Missione Clima: perch√© si rischia il flop se non si abbattono le emissioni delle case
text:
Raggiungere la neutralit√† climatica entro il 2030, con vent‚Äôanni di anticipo rispetto a quanto previsto dal Green Deal europeo. Una sfida molto ambiziosa e difficile da realizzare, quella che Bologna, assieme ad altre 99 citt√† europee, si √® data all‚Äôinterno di un progetto pilota finanziato dall‚ÄôUnione europea, la Missione "100 Climate-Neutral and Smart Cities by 2030". Non √® per√≤ solo una dichiarazione di intenti. Al contrario, le 100 citt√†, di cui 9 italiane, hanno redatto un vero e proprio contratto climatico (il climate city contract) sottoposto alla Commissione Europea nel 2024, che raccoglie azioni, strategie e linee applicative, con indicatori e investimenti previsti. Obiettivo √® la riduzione delle emissioni tale da azzerare il bilancio tra CO2 emessa e assorbita in citt√†.

author: Jennifer Baldino Bonett
title: ChristianaCare Recognized for Partnership in Helping Families Stay Safe and Independent at Home - ChristianaCare News
text:
A regional nonprofit that helps keep our neighbors safe at home has recognized ChristianaCare for its generous partnership.
[Good Neighbors Home Repair](https://www.goodneighborshomerepair.org/) thanked ChristianaCare for its financial support at the nonprofit‚Äôs Stories of Hope celebration on Oct. 24. Good Neighbors offers critical, no-cost home repair services to homeowners in need across parts of Chester and Lancaster counties in Pennsylvania and New Castle County in Delaware.
ChristianaCare‚Äôs support for Good Neighbors reflects a broader commitment to addressing the social, behavioral and environmental factors that impact health.
‚ÄúTogether, we are building healthier communities.‚Äù ‚Äî Bettina Tweardy Riveros
‚ÄúAt ChristianaCare, we strive to deliver health, not just health care, to the people we serve,‚Äù said Bettina Tweardy Riveros, ChristianaCare‚Äôs chief health equity officer.
‚ÄúWe recognize that we can‚Äôt do it alone, and that‚Äôs why we invest in organizations like Good Neighbors, empowering them to deepen their impact and bring positive change to one family at a time. Together, we are building healthier communities.‚Äù
[Click here](https://christianacare.org/us/en/about-us/who-we-are/community-benefit#tabs-411b6be0f0-item-f8f3fd687a-tab) for more on ChristianaCare‚Äôs community benefit initiatives.
Good Neighbors received a grant from ChristianaCare‚Äôs Community Investment Fund, which supports partnerships with nonprofit organizations to build the collective capacity of communities to address non-medical drivers of health.
Support from ChristianaCare has allowed Good Neighbors to make important home modifications for patients referred by our caregivers.
By adding handrails, ramps, bathroom grab bars and other safety features, Good Neighbors, based in Kennett Square, Pennsylvania, helps seniors, people with disabilities and others recovering from illness live safely and stay independent in their homes.
‚ÄúThis partnership allows us to make these repairs, helping people steadily recover.‚Äù ‚Äî Brad Dunn
‚ÄúThanks to ChristianaCare‚Äôs support, we‚Äôre able to help people who have just come home from the hospital or are facing new health challenges,‚Äù said Good Neighbors Advancement Director Brad Dunn.
‚ÄúMany of them are returning to homes with safety issues that they can‚Äôt afford to fix. This partnership allows us to make these repairs, helping people steadily recover and maintain their quality of life, so they can focus on healing and safely moving forward.‚Äù

author: Gol Caracol
title: Kylian Mbapp√© mostr√≥ su magia por la banda: su gol HOY en Real Madrid vs. Celta de Vigo
text:

 volvi√≥ a reportarse con el Real Madrid. En esta oportunidad, el delantero franc√©s abri√≥ el marcador para su equipo en el partido de la Copa del Rey contra el Celta de Vigo, este jueves 16 de enero, en el Santiago Bernab√©u.
El tanto del n√∫mero '9' se present√≥ al minuto 37 tras una acci√≥n en ofensiva de los visitantes y en la que reclamaron penalti de Lunin. A partir de ah√≠, el conjunto 'merengue' puso en marcha un gran 'contra' con Ceballos, que luego le cedi√≥ el bal√≥n a Mbapp√©.
El exPSG condujo el bal√≥n por la banda, se sac√≥ a sus marcadores y termin√≥ defiendo para el 1-0 para el Real Madrid.

author: Rachel Cormack
title: CRN‚Äôs 197-Foot Custom Superyacht Can Cruise the Shallowest of Waters
text: [CRN](https://robbreport.com/tag/crn/)‚Äôs [superyacht](https://robbreport.com/tag/superyacht/) [Comfortably Numb](https://www.crn-yacht.com/en-us/News-and-events/Detail/t/MY-Comfortably-Numb-is-the-perfect-blend-of/n/2289) has a lot in common with Pink Floyd‚Äôs 1979 hit: It‚Äôs epic, powerful, and totally unique. The bespoke 197-footer was actually delivered in December 2022, but the Italian yard released all the juicy details regarding the build on Wednesday. Comfortably Numb was designed by the Italian architects at Nuvolari Lenard and handcrafted by the team at CRN‚Äôs superyacht yard in Ancona, Italy. As such, the vessel showcases true made in Italy flair and finesse. Comfortably Numb was developed for ‚Äúexpert owners‚Äù who wanted a high-performance displacement vessel capable of traversing the globe. To that end, the all-aluminum cruiser has a draft of under eight feet that allows it to cruise in the shallow waters of the Caribbean, for instance. (For comparison‚Äôs sake, 200-foot steel superyacht, like say, [Majestic](https://www.merlewood.com/luxury-yacht-for-sale-52676/majestic-yacht-specs), has a draft of around 11 feet.) It also meets the rigorous IMO Tier-III emissions standards, meaning it can cruise in protected waters. To meet the exacting weight and speed requirements stipulated by the owner, CRN also incorporated innovative technologies and materials into the design. The Italian yard created a system of precise strain gauges, for example, that constantly monitor the vessel‚Äôs weight and center of gravity via Wi-Fi. The team also opted to use lightweight cork during the application and leveling of the teak decking rather than other higher-density alternatives. As a result, the yacht has a lower fighting weight and is faster on the waves. Comfortably Numb is also the first CRN fleet member to be equipped with two MTU 20V 4000 M93L engines. This setup allows the yacht to reach a top speed of over 25 knots and a cruising speed of 22.5 knots. In addition, a SCR (Selective Catalytic Reduction) system ensures bump-free jaunts. Comfortably Numb has a distinctive stylistic identity like her namesake, too. Inspired by automotive design, the 197-footer showcases long, sleek lines and a sharp, pointed bow. ‚ÄúThe sculpted silhouette and bold exterior styling are eye-catching even from a distance, breathing life into a one-of-a-kind, full-custom icon,‚Äù CRN said in a statement. The light-filled interior is characterized by soaring ceilings and large floor-to-ceiling windows that provide sweeping ocean views. Spanning five decks, the yacht can accommodate up to 12 guests across six suites and 13 crew. She also has generous living areas and an outdoor Jacuzzi. Pink Floyd would be proud.

author: Olivia Yepez
title: Full ‚ÄòSTEAM‚Äô ahead: New tech lab opens for Muscogee County students
text:
WRBL Columbus Full ‚ÄòSTEAM‚Äô ahead: New tech lab opens for Muscogee County students Olivia Yepez Thu, December 5, 2024 at 11:11 PM UTC 2 min read
COLUMBUS, Ga. ( WRBL ) ‚Äî The future is STEAM. At least according to local nonprofit Let‚Äôs Grow STEAM X which opened a new learning lab for Muscogee County students the morning of Dec. 5.
‚ÄúScience, engineering, technology is what‚Äîwhere‚Äîthe world is going,‚Äù Robbie Branscomb, CEO and founder of Let‚Äôs Grow STEAM X , said.
She added it‚Äôs important to give local students exposure to the tools and technology used in STEAM (science, technology, engineering, arts and mathematics).
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement ‚ÄòThe Nutcracker‚Äô: Professional dancers join Columbus Ballet for performance
‚ÄúEnsuring that they are prepared, ensuring that they have a good understanding of what‚Äôs required of them so they can be successful,‚Äù Branscomb said, ‚ÄúI think we just don‚Äôt have enough resources like that in the community.‚Äù
J.D. Davis Elementary students became the first local children to check out the lab, following a ribbon cutting ceremony this morning. It will allow students to explore science, technology, engineering, arts and mathematics in a hands-on environment.
J.D. Davis Elementary students became the first local children to check out the lab, following a ribbon cutting ceremony. (Olivia Yepez) The future is STEAM. At least according to local nonprofit Let‚Äôs Grow STEAMX which opened a new learning lab for Muscogee County students the morning of Dec. 5. (Olivia Yepez) Let‚Äôs Grow STEAMX plans to partner with local companies and organizations to inspire students to chase careers in STEAM. (Olivia Yepez) Let‚Äôs Grow STEAMX is preparing to begin its annual gravity racing season, which will allow students to design, engineer and race their own soap box cars. (Olivia Yepez) The building, which has been under construction for three months, was funded through grants, sponsorships and community support. It was opened in partnership with Amdocs and the Black Professionals Employee Networking Group (BPENG).
Advertisement Advertisement It features a tech lab, as well as multiple classrooms for hands-on learning.
Let‚Äôs Grow STEAM X plans to partner with local companies and organizations to inspire students to chase careers in STEAM.
BizPitch: Auburn junior proposes hot take on coffee, UGA grad uses sound to clean pools
BPENG President Curtina Brewton, who works with Amdocs, is hopeful for the impact the new lab will have on the community. She envisions Muscogee County students becoming future AI consultants, computer experts and more.
Brewton said, ‚ÄúIf I can get ten out of the 30 to go and build [a] future for the next, our job is done.‚Äù
Advertisement Advertisement More in U.S. CEO Killer Spent 10 Days in NYC After Grueling Bus Trip The Daily Beast Passenger stinks up entire plane with ‚Äòdiabolical‚Äô in-flight meal choice: ‚ÄòScented food is a crime‚Äô NY Post Massive lottery jackpot is set to expire. Mystery player was part of an incredibly rare draw LA Times 2 kindergarteners in 'critical but stable condition' after Christian school shooting ABC News Let‚Äôs Grow STEAM X has been working to bring more educational opportunities to Muscogee County students for the past eight years. It is preparing to begin its annual gravity racing season, which will allow students to design, engineer and race their own soap box cars.
You can find more information about the new lab and the gravity racing season by visiting the Let‚Äôs Grow STEAM X website .

author: Lennart Schwenck
title: ‚ÄûGeschmacklos": M√ºller-Produkt st√∂√üt Kundin auf - Drogeriemarkt zieht Konsequenzen
text:
‚ÄûGeschmacklos‚Äú: M√ºller-Produkt st√∂√üt Kundin auf ‚Äì Drogeriemarkt zieht Konsequenzen
Eine M√ºller-Kundin findet ein anz√ºgliches Modellbau-Set in der Spielwarenabteilung. Der Drogeriemarkt reagiert prompt. Auch der Hersteller √§u√üert sich.
M√ºnchen ‚Äì Ein unscheinbares Modellbau-Set erregt aktuell viel Aufsehen: Das Figuren-Set ‚ÄûVoyeure‚Äú der Firma NOCH aus Wangen im Allg√§u zeigt halbnackte Frauen, einen Mann mit Fernglas ‚Äì und ein Kind, das sich die Augen zuh√§lt. Es ist Teil einer Produktreihe f√ºr Modelleisenbahn-Landschaften. Das eigentlich unauff√§llige Set aus dem Standardsortiment wurde zum Zentrum einer hitzigen Debatte √ºber Geschmack, Ethik und die Grenzen der Miniaturdarstellung.
Ausl√∂ser f√ºr den Wirbel war eine Beschwerde: Christine B. entdeckte das Set in der Spielwarenabteilung einer M√ºller-Filiale in M√ºnchen. Gegen√ºber Bild kritisierte sie: ‚ÄûHier wird Voyeurismus verharmlost und Kindern als harmlose Unterhaltung vermittelt.‚Äú F√ºr sie sei das ‚Äûnicht nur geschmacklos, sondern auch h√∂chst verantwortungslos.‚Äú
Figuren-Set verschwindet nach Beschwerde von Kundin aus dem M√ºller-Sortiment
Der Drogeriemarkt M√ºller reagierte prompt. Ein Sprecher des Unternehmens erkl√§rte gegen√ºber der BILD-Zeitung: ‚ÄûBeim Handelskonzern M√ºller legen wir gr√∂√üten Wert auf ein verantwortungsvolles und familienfreundliches Sortiment. [‚Ä¶] Die betreffenden Artikel wurden umgehend entfernt.‚Äú Man bedaure den Vorfall sehr und pr√ºfe derzeit, wie √§hnliche Fehler in Zukunft vermieden werden k√∂nnten. Das Figuren-Set ist mittlerweile aus dem Sortiment und Online-Handel entfernt worden.
Die Firma Noch GmbH, ein traditionsreiches Familienunternehmen mit 114-j√§hriger Geschichte und europ√§ischer Marktf√ºhrerschaft im Bereich Modellbauzubeh√∂r, zeigt sich angesichts der Emp√∂rung gelassen. Gesch√§ftsf√ºhrer Rainer Noch erkl√§rte gegen√ºber dem SWR: ‚ÄûDie Verkaufszahlen haben am Dienstagmorgen schon deutlich angezogen.‚Äú Er rechne damit, dass das Set bald ausverkauft sein werde. Dass gerade dieses Figuren-Set f√ºr Diskussionen sorgt, verwundert Noch: ‚ÄûDie Realit√§t kennt keine Tabus, und um ein wirklichkeitsnahes Abbild zu schaffen, ist es notwendig, auch jene Aspekte darzustellen, die zum menschlichen Leben geh√∂ren.‚Äú Das Set sei seit Jahren im Sortiment und habe bislang kaum Kritik ausgel√∂st.
Hersteller √§u√üert sich: ‚ÄûWir wollen das Leben in all seinen Facetten darstellen‚Äú
Das Set ‚ÄûVoyeure‚Äú ist Teil einer Linie von Miniaturfiguren, mit denen Noch laut eigener Website ‚Äûhumorvolle oder ungew√∂hnliche Szenen‚Äú darstellen will. Im Online-Shop wird es als geeignet f√ºr ‚Äûerotische Szenen in Ihrer Modelllandschaftsgestaltung‚Äú beworben. Die Figuren sind √ºbliche Miniaturfiguren, wie man sie zum Beispiel aus dem Miniaturwunderland in Hamburg kennt. W√§hrend kritische Stimmen, wie die von Christine B., das Set als sexualisierte Darstellung mit problematischer Botschaft einstufen, betont der Hersteller seine k√ºnstlerische und realit√§tsnahe Freiheit. ‚ÄûWir wollen das Leben in all seinen Facetten darstellen,‚Äú sagte Rainer Noch gegen√ºber dem SWR.
Die Aufmerksamkeit ist f√ºr das Unternehmen aus dem Allg√§u offenbar kein Nachteil. Bereits auf der Spielwarenmesse in N√ºrnberg pr√§sentierte die Noch GmbH eine neue Linie namens ‚ÄûFunny-Scenes‚Äú, die Sets mit Bezeichnungen wie ‚ÄûSaufbr√ºder‚Äú, ‚ÄûSeitensprung‚Äú oder ‚ÄûStra√üenstrich‚Äú umfasst. Diese sollen ab Oktober im Handel erh√§ltlich sein. Das, was der eine lustig findet, dem anderen sauer aufst√∂√üt, ist keine Seltenheit. So erhiet etwa auch ein Mafia-Brettspiel heftigen Gegenwind. (ls)

author: Miriam McNabb
title: Johnette Technologies Wins Indian Army UAV Contract - DRONELIFE
text: Indian Army Awards Contract to Johnnette Technologies for Supply of Made-in-India Johnnette JF-2 Tactical, India‚Äôs First Crash Resistant Drone Johnnette Technologies, a leading Indian Unmanned Systems manufacturer headquartered in Noida, has secured a contract from the Indian Army to supply its flagship tactical fixed-wing UAV, the Johnnette JF-2, for border surveillance. The company proudly asserts that the JF-2 is India‚Äôs first crash-resistant drone, representing a significant milestone in the nation‚Äôs pursuit of self-reliance in defense manufacturing. Founded in 2014 by Lt Cdr John Livingstone, a retired Indian Navy officer, Johnnette Technologies has been at the forefront of developing cutting-edge unmanned systems technology for both military and commercial applications in India. The company‚Äôs commitment aligns with the ‚ÄòMake in India‚Äô initiative spearheaded by Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi. Lt Cdr John Livingstone, Founder, and CEO of Johnnette Technologies, expressed his pride in contributing to national security: ‚ÄúIt is a great feeling to be able to serve the nation even after retiring from the Defence Forces. My team has done prolonged R&D and have created this tactical fixed-wing UAV, Johnnette JF-2, for the Military requirements. The uniqueness of our lightweight JF-2 is its ability to be crash-resistant in multiple terrains due to its sturdy belly-landing design.‚Äù The Johnnette JF-2 is a hand-launched fixed-wing tactical UAV designed specifically for surveillance and reconnaissance operations. Equipped with a high-definition day camera and a thermal imaging camera, the platform is tailored for day and night operations. Noteworthy features include a crash-proof avionics bay, anti-jamming, and anti-spoofing capabilities, making it an ideal solution for land forces. This marks the first deployment of a fixed-wing UAV in its class by the Indian Army for border surveillance. Johnnette Technologies Pvt Ltd., established in November 2014, has been a trailblazer in Unmanned Systems Technology in India. The company has consistently delivered cutting-edge aerospace systems to the paramilitary, commercial, aerospace, and defense sectors, with a primary focus on unmanned systems technology. In addition to the Johnnette JF-2, the company also manufactures low-cost loitering munitions (Kamikaze drones) and has ambitious plans to produce Medium Altitude Long Endurance (MALE) Unmanned Combat Aerial Vehicles (UCAVs) in the future. As India continues to strengthen its indigenous defense capabilities, Johnnette Technologies‚Äô innovative contributions underscore the growing role of domestic firms in meeting the evolving requirements of the armed forces. Read more: [Archer Aviation, InterGlobe Enterprises Plan All-Electric Air Taxi Service Across India by 2026](https://dronelife.com/2023/11/10/archer-aviation-interglobe-enterprises-plan-all-electric-air-taxi-service-across-india-by-2026/) [India‚Äôs Garuda Aerospace Opens Retail Drone Stores](https://dronelife.com/2023/11/10/indias-garuda-aerospace-opens-retail-drone-stores/) [Indian State Supports Domestic Drone Industry with Agricultural Mechanization Subsidy](https://dronelife.com/2023/09/27/indian-state-supports-domestic-drone-industry-with-agricultural-mechanization-subsidy/) [India‚Äôs Minister of Civil Aviation Raises National Flag with Fleet of Drones](https://dronelife.com/2023/08/16/indias-minister-of-civil-aviation-raises-national-flag-with-fleet-of-drones/) Miriam McNabb is the Editor-in-Chief of DRONELIFE and CEO of JobForDrones, a professional drone services marketplace, and a fascinated observer of the emerging drone industry and the regulatory environment for drones. Miriam has penned over 3,000 articles focused on the commercial drone space and is an international speaker and recognized figure in the industry. Miriam has a degree from the University of Chicago and over 20 years of experience in high tech sales and marketing for new technologies. For drone industry consulting or writing, [Email Miriam](mailto:miriam@dronelife.com). TWITTER: [@spaldingbarker](https://twitter.com/spaldingbarker) Subscribe to DroneLife [here](https://dronelife.us8.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=5cdad320c6921b55059dc6269&id=3407389e35).

author: @freie_presse
title: Die Stadt der Kan√§le - und Taschendiebe
text:
Man h√§tte gewarnt sein k√∂nnen. Die Hinweistafeln h√§ngen ja in der ganzen Stadt, am Bahnhof Santa Lucia, auf dem Markusplatz, an den Vaporetto-Anlegestellen, und das in allen m√∂glichen Sprachen. "Attenzione borseggiatori". "Attention pickpockets". "Beware pickpockets". Und "Achtung Taschendiebe" selbstverst√§ndlich auch. Aber dann ist das Portemonnaie halt doch nicht mehr in der Hosentasche. So geht es in Venedig ein paar Dutzend Urlaubern jeden Tag.
Was das Delikt Taschendiebstahl in der Kriminalit√§tsstatistik angeht, kann die italienische Lagunenstadt mit ihren nicht einmal mehr 50.000 Einwohnern locker mit Millionenmetropolen mithalten. Vor allem jetzt in der Hauptsaison: Die t√§glich bis zu 150.000 Besucher aus aller Welt versprechen lohnende Beute. In den engen Gassen sind keineswegs nur Kleinkriminelle aktiv, sondern richtige Banden: M√§nner, Frauen, Kinder. Und auch sie kommen in der Regel von au√üerhalb, Tagesbesucher sozusagen.
In Venedig ein altes Problem
Nun ist das Problem mit den geklauten Geldb√∂rsen in Venedig nicht ganz neu. Die Lokalzeitung "Il Gazzettino" klagte schon 1961: "Nessun giorno senza ladri" ("Kein Tag ohne Diebe"). Mit dem zunehmenden Tourismus ist es inzwischen aber so schlimm geworden, dass B√ºrgermeister Luigi Brugnaro jetzt einen Hilferuf an Regierung und Parlament in Rom richtet - was die Venezianer mit ihrem in mehr als anderthalb Jahrtausenden angesammelten Stolz eher ungern tun. Er fordert dringend h√§rtere Gesetze.
-
Auf dem Markusplatz ist die Gefahr besonders gro√ü. (Archivbild) Foto: Christoph Sator/dpa
Einen Eindruck, wie gro√ü das Problem inzwischen ist, bekommt man im Polizeirevier gegen√ºber dem Markusdom. Dort gibt es einen Raum mit 15 schwarzen S√§cken voller Taschen und Brieftaschen - allein die Fundst√ºcke aus den vergangenen anderthalb Monaten. In der Regel werfen die Diebe ihre Beute weg, wenn sie das Bargeld und die Kreditkarten herausgenommen haben. An Ausweispapieren sind sie wenig interessiert. Man findet die Portemonnaies dann auf dem Pflaster, in Briefk√§sten, in G√§rten oder auch in den Kan√§len.
Die "baby borseggiatori" - die "Baby-Taschendiebe"
L√§ngst handelt es sich dabei um organisierte Kriminalit√§t, das Werk von Banden. Meist sind es Leute vom Festland, aus St√§dten wie Mailand, die f√ºr ihr kriminelles Tagwerk nach Venedig gebracht werden, manchmal eigens in Kleinbussen. Inzwischen werden sogar Kinder im Alter von 12 oder 13 Jahren erwischt - gerade noch unter 14, der Altersgrenze f√ºr Strafbarkeit. Man nennt sie "baby borseggiatori": "Baby-Taschendiebe". Auf Italienisch klingt das nat√ºrlich besser und harmloser. Meist kommen sie nach ein paar Stunden auf dem Revier am selben Tag wieder frei.
-
An den Anlegestellen von Gondeln und F√§hren empfiehlt die Polizei besondere Wachsamkeit. (Archivbild) Foto: Christoph Sator/dpa
Als besonders gef√§hrliche Gegenden gelten Santa Lucia, wo die Z√ºge vom Festland ankommen, der Busbahnhof an der Piazzale Roma, die Anlegestellen der Gondeln und sonstigen Boote sowie die engen Gassen zwischen Rialtobr√ºcke und Markusplatz. Manchmal ist dort in diesen Tagen kaum noch ein Durchkommen. Im dichten Gedr√§nge haben Taschendiebe leichtes Spiel. Zwar hat die Stadt mehr als 850 √úberwachungskameras aufh√§ngen lassen. Die Aufnahmen laufen auf einer der vielen Inseln in einem Kontrollraum zusammen, der rund um die Uhr besetzt ist. Aber bis die Beamten da sind, ist es oft zu sp√§t.
Polizeichef: "Gro√üe Blase der Straflosigkeit"
Au√üerdem, und das sorgt aktuell f√ºr enorm √Ñrger, ist die Gefahr, ins Gef√§ngnis zu m√ºssen, auch f√ºr erwischte Diebe nicht hoch. Polizeichef Marco Agostini klagte diese Woche in der Tageszeitung "Corriere della Sera" √ºber eine "gro√üe Blase der Straflosigkeit". "Weil Taschendiebst√§hle nur auf Anzeige hin verfolgt werden k√∂nnen. Und wenn der Beraubte nicht zur Verhandlung erscheint, gilt die Anzeige als fallengelassen." Die meisten Opfer sind Ausl√§nder. Viele reisen am selben Tag wieder ab. So kommt es nur selten zum Prozess. Derzeit sitzen wegen Taschendiebst√§hlen in Venedig gerade einmal vier H√§ftlinge ein.
B√ºrgermeister Brugnaro forderte die Politik in Rom deshalb in einem landesweit verbreiteten Appell auf, die Gesetze zu versch√§rfen. Eine vor einiger Zeit verabschiedete Reform, wonach zahlreiche kleinere Delikte nur noch auf Antrag der Gesch√§digten verfolgt werden, will er r√ºckg√§ngig machen. Bislang gab es jedoch nur einige kleinere √Ñnderungen; beim Taschendiebstahl blieb alles beim Alten. "Wir d√ºrfen uns nicht daran gew√∂hnen, dass solche Delikte zum Alltag geh√∂ren", so der B√ºrgermeister.
topics: Crime, Law and Justice->robbery and theft
